qas.question: What battle was the advance in the Arakan halted to release troops for?
Who aided the Americans and Chinese during the advance in northern Burma?
When did the Chinese invade northern Burma?
What fortified position was captured by the Chinese Expeditionary Force?
What airfield was taken by the NCAC in August, 1944?

context: Although the advance in the Arakan had been halted to release troops and aircraft for the <a0_0>Battle of Imphal<a0_0/>, the Americans and Chinese had continued to advance in northern Burma, aided by the <a1_0>Chindits<a1_0/> operating against the Japanese lines of communication. In the <a2_0>middle of 1944<a2_0/> the Chinese Expeditionary Force invaded northern Burma from Yunnan province. They captured a fortified position at <a3_0>Mount Song<a3_0/>. By the time campaigning ceased during the monsoon rains, the NCAC had secured a vital airfield at <a4_0>Myitkyina<a4_0/> (August 1944), which eased the problems of air resupply from India to China over "The Hump".
